metadata.title: CVE-2023-23924 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Dompdf is an HTML to PDF converter. The URI validation on dompdf 2.0.1 canbe bypassed on SVG parsing by passing `<image>` tags with uppercaseletters. This may lead to arbitrary object unserialize on PHP < 8, throughthe `phar` URL wrapper. An attacker can exploit the vulnerability to callarbitrary URL with arbitrary protocols, if they can provide a SVG file todompdf. In PHP versions before 8.0.0, it leads to arbitrary unserialize,that will lead to the very least to an arbitrary file deletion and evenremote code execution, depending on classes that are available.

criterions.comment: php-dompdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
